intro: Diporidium fascicularis, commonly known as the clustered diporidium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are typically clustered in fascicles, giving it its scientific name. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
